newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Santander, BCH say in talks for Antena 3.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Santander, BCH say in talks for Antena 3.

text.p: Spanish banks Santander and BCH said in a statement to Spain's stock market commission on Thursday they were in talks with Antena 3 to increase their participation in the television channel.
Telefonica earlier confirmed that it was negotiating for a stake in Antena 3.

BCH, which already has 10 percent of the private TV channel, said it was meeting with Telefonica and Antena 3 with the aim of "directly or indirectly increasing its actual participation in the capital of Antena 3 de Television SA".
Santander, which has a 10 percent participation through its subsidiary Banesto , said it was in talks to buy a stake directly.
Local media reported on Thursday that Telefonica was seeking 25 percent of Antena 3 and a majority stake in a related company with television viewing rights for soccer matches.
The reports, which the participants would not confirm, said each bank would also end up with a 25 percent stake of Antena 3 in total.
